title: Update project license to use spdx identifier for the "Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International" license.
body:
I was hoping the project owner would consider updating the project license to use spdx identifier for the "Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International" license.  Your license in github -> https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/LICENSE
This is no change to the license at all, but then allows anyone using the github license API to get an exact match of the licensed used and not have to use any string magic to come up with your license.

If your unfamiliar with SPDX see spdx.org. And your particular license I am guessing would be https://spdx.org/licenses/CC-BY-4.0.html.

Pretty sure this can be done in your settings somewhere.  Here is an example of your API json and your 
spdx_id is null.

{
  "name": "LICENSE",
  "path": "LICENSE",
  "sha": "e056e7c3ec54533985dfb3a4c6ef70dab8ca2e42",
  "size": 18650,
  "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/mono/SkiaSharp/contents/LICENSE?ref=master",
  "html_url": "https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/LICENSE",
  "git_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/mono/SkiaSharp/git/blobs/e056e7c3ec54533985dfb3a4c6ef70dab8ca2e42",
  "download_url": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mono/SkiaSharp/master/LICENSE",
  "type": "file",
  "content": "removed as this was very long"
  "encoding": "base64",
  "_links": {
  "self": "https://api.github.com/repos/mono/SkiaSharp/contents/LICENSE?ref=master",
  "git": "https://api.github.com/repos/mono/SkiaSharp/git/blobs/e056e7c3ec54533985dfb3a4c6ef70dab8ca2e42",
  "html": "https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/LICENSE"
  },
  "license": {
  "key": "other",
  "name": "Other",
  "spdx_id": null,
  "url": null,
  "node_id": "MDc6TGljZW5zZTA="
  }
}

I also noticed this URL in your nuget package "https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=868514" which then redirects you to "https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/LICENSE.md" which is a Xamarin/Microsoft license...  So not sure what that is about either...
2 different licenses?
